column4: I d/l'd the uninstall UB OS through terminal. When I click the link it tells "Please use this software in a live session". What does that mean? What are the uninstaller steps?
could you explain that in more detail.
no abbreviations would help
sorry
I have only ubuntu 10.10... I want to uninstall it
you want to install something else just install over it.
Sorry so slow...I need to uninstall Ubuntu and re-install windows for my hub..he wants linux gone now
you can delete linux from the windows cd or boot a ubuntu cd and do it from gparted.
What do I choose from the ubuntu to use gparted
the live cd has gparted intalled, turn off the swap if there is one and delete all partitions, which may include a extended.
my options are Try Ubuntu and Install Ubuntu (from cd)
try ubuntu I see your question now. :D
after try ubuntu, what do I do to start gparted?
it is in the menu.
system settings?
what is the release your booting
in prefernces opr admin
i'm looking....
correct you are runing a iso, yu have to do changes to save them or delete the hd.
I found gparted
never heard of the OS unistaller, just take a screen shot of gparted screen shot is in the menu put it in a imagebin and post the http and I will tell you what is going on.
